ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]How to build an agentic AI graph application in 10 minutes using MCP | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: How to build an agentic AI graph application in 10 minutes using MCP | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Building Agentic AI Applications with Neptune MCP: A Practical Guide
This technical walkthrough demonstrates how to rapidly develop AI-powered graph applications using AWS Strands SDK and Neptune MCP server, enabling developers to create intelligent, graph-based solutions efficiently.
Technical Overview: â€¢ Setting up Neptune MCP server environment â€¢ Integrating AWS Strands SDK components â€¢ Implementing agentic behavior patterns â€¢ Configuring graph-based AI interactions
The demonstration covers: â€¢ Basic setup and configuration â€¢ Core API implementation â€¢ Agent behavior definition â€¢ Graph query integration
Key Implementation Steps: â€¢ Environment initialization â€¢ Graph schema design â€¢ Agent configuration
Practical Applications: â€¢ Intelligent data analysis â€¢ Automated decision systems â€¢ Knowledge graph navigation â€¢ Dynamic relationship mapping
This guide is designed for developers and architects working with: â€¢ Graph databases â€¢ AI/ML systems â€¢ Knowledge graphs â€¢ Automated reasoning systems

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [TED]The Hidden Cost of Buying Gold | Claudia Vega | TED

ns2:group.ns2:title: The Hidden Cost of Buying Gold | Claudia Vega | TED
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Gold may glitter, but the hidden cost of mining it is devastating. Amazon researcher and TED Fellow Claudia Vega exposes how mercury pollution from artisanal gold mining poisons local communities and destroys rainforests â€” and shows why protecting the planet is far more valuable than any treasure. (Recorded at TED Fellows Films 2025 on April 7, 2025)

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Transforming Airline Tech With AI Innovation | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Transforming Airline Tech With AI Innovation | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
In this episode, we sit down with Lawrence Fong, Director of Digital and IT at Cathay, as he reveals how one of Asia's premier airlines is leveraging AI and machine learning to transform every aspect of their operations. Drawing from his 30+ years of experience at Cathay Pacific, Lawrence shares practical insights on building customer-centric digital transformation, fostering innovation culture, and managing change in the volatile aviation industry. Together with AWS Enterprise Strategist Xia Zhang, Lawrence discusses how leaders in highly regulated industries can embrace digital culture, build agile teams, and create innovation frameworks that drive measurable business outcomes while maintaining premium service standards.
Learn more about Executive Insights: https://go.aws/4nyPE8a
Subscribe to AWS: https://go.aws/subscribe
Create a free AWS account: https://go.aws/signup Try AWS for free: https://go.aws/free Connect with an expert: https://go.aws/contact Explore more: https://go.aws/more

Do you have technical AWS questions? Ask the community of experts on AWS re:Post: https://go.aws/3lPaoPb
Why AWS? Amazon Web Services is the worldâ€™s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud, enabling customers to build anything they can imagine. We offer the greatest choice of innovative cloud capabilities and expertise, on the most extensive global infrastructure with industry-leading security, reliability, and performance.
#AWS #AmazonWebServices #CloudComputing #AirlineTransformation #AIinAviation #CustomerExperienceDesign #AWSExecutiveInsights #AviationInnovation

ns2:group.ns2:title: Build Hour: AgentKit
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Introducing AgentKitâ€”build, deploy, and optimize agentic workflows with a complete set of tools. This Build Hour demos how to design workflows visually and embed agentic UIs faster to create multi-step tool-calling agents.
Samarth Madduru (Solutions Engineering), Tasia Potasinski (Product Marketing), and Henry Scott-Green (Product, Platform) cover: â€¢ Build with Agent Builder- a visual canvas based orchestration tool â€¢ Deploy with ChatKit- an embeddable, customizable chat UI â€¢ Optimize with new Evals capabilities- datasets, trace grading, auto-prompt optimization â€¢ Real World Examples from startups to Fortune 500 companies like Ramp, Rippling, HubSpot, Carlyle, and Bain â€¢ Live Q&A
ğŸ‘‰ AgentKit Docs: https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/agents/agent-builder ğŸ‘‰ AgentKit Cookbook: https://cookbook.openai.com/examples/agentkit/agentkit_walkthrough ğŸ‘‰ ChatKit Studio: https://chatkit.studio/playground ğŸ‘‰ Sign up for upcoming live Build Hours: https://webinar.openai.com/buildhours/
00:00 Introduction 04:50 Agent Builder 21:27 ChatKit 24:53 Evals 35:17 Real World Examples

ns2:group.ns2:title: ENEOS Materials accelerates manufacturing productivity with ChatGPT Enterprise
ns2:group.ns2:description:
As one of Japanâ€™s earliest adopters of ChatGPT Enterprise, ENEOS Materials built 1,000+ custom GPTs, achieved 90%+ weekly usage, and saw over 80% of employees report significant workflow gains. These capabilities now speed complex investigations, enhance training effectiveness with data-driven insights, and improve engineering safety and design quality across plants.
Read the full story: https://openai.com/index/eneos-materials/

ns2:group.ns2:description: MIXI deployed ChatGPT Enterprise to all employees in 45 days, reaching 80%+ weekly usage within three months and creating 1,600+ GPTs. Teams now work faster and more confidently, with some projects cutting work hours by over 90% and cross-functional workflows becoming routine. Read the full story: https://openai.com/index/mixi/

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [TechWorld with Nana]13 Years in QA: Why Traditional QA is Disappearing (And What to Do)

ns2:group.ns2:title: 13 Years in QA: Why Traditional QA is Disappearing (And What to Do)
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Rody's journey: Learn the skills that matter and how to learn them without quitting your job â–º Get your DevOps Starter Kit here: https://bit.ly/4oIb2ZF â–º Get Demo Projects from our website: https://bit.ly/3L7rtAa
Rody (15 years in QA) shares his career journey from being a senior test automation engineer to embracing DevOps and eventually transitioning to freelance work.
I'm breaking down this full interview about the future of QA and test automation and the real impact of AI on testing roles. You will learn the specific skills that matter, how to learn them without quitting your job and the specific path that he took to become a highly demanded future-proof engineer. And throughout this conversation, I will break down the technical concepts and what this means for you. Whether you are in QA engineering, thinking about DevOps or transitioning from a different background or just trying to understand where engineering careers are heading.
#devopscareer #devops #testautomation
â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬ Thanks Rody, for being so open and sharing your journey with the community ğŸ’™ â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬ â–º Learn more about QA: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P3-8CNCS50k â–º Connect with Rody on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/rody-bothe-0a205066/
â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬ ğŸ™ï¸ PART OF NEW INTERVIEW SERIES ğŸ™ï¸ â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬ This series features in-depth conversations with industry experts like Kelsey Hightower and real career journeys, from people who made it happen, sharing practical insights on learning paths, interview preparation, and day-to-day DevOps work.
From manual QA to DevOps. From network engineering to cloud architecture. From non-tech backgrounds to DevSecOps lead.
I capture real transformation stories from our DevOps bootcamp graduates about building a DevOps career. Hear how people learned Kubernetes, prepared project portfolios, landed multiple job offers, and navigate the evolving landscape of AI in infrastructure. Whether you're considering DevOps or already in the field, these conversations reveal what's actually working.
â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬ T I M E S T A M P S â° â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬ 00:00 Introduction to Rody & Overview 01:44 The Shift to DevOps in QA 03:58 The Day-to-Day Pain 08:51 Rody's Career Decision 12:15 Learning DevOps: The Initial Steps 22:00 Balancing Family and Learning 26:26 Connecting the dots & Applying it at work 26:53 Was it worth it? 33:01 The 5-Minute Hire 36:49 Test Automation Role in 5 or 10 years 37:55 The AI Reality 41:47 Next Career Steps - DevSecOps 44:32 Advice for QAs - Where to start? 47:41 What would you do differently? 50:11 4 Practical Takeaways for you
â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬ Connect with me ğŸ‘‹ â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬ INSTAGRAM â–º https://bit.ly/2F3LXYJ TWITTER â–º https://bit.ly/3i54PUB LINKEDIN â–º https://bit.ly/3hWOLVT

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [TED]The Most Powerful Predictor of Team Success | Rafael Chiuzi | TED

ns2:group.ns2:title: The Most Powerful Predictor of Team Success | Rafael Chiuzi | TED
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Remember that gut-clenching fear of speaking up in class? Organizational psychologist Rafael Chiuzi reveals how that same feeling shows up in the workplace, limiting productivity and the free exchange of ideas. Backed by decades of research and hands-on consulting, he unpacks the science of psychological safety â€” and shares three actionable steps to build teams where curiosity thrives and courage replaces fear. (Recorded at TEDxMcMasterU on March 5, 2022)

ns2:group.ns2:title: ã€æ­£ç‰‡ã€‘è´¾æ¨ŸæŸ¯Ã—ç½—æ°¸æµ©ï¼æˆä¸ºè´¾æ¨ŸæŸ¯ï¼ˆä¸Šï¼‰ ï½œ CrossRoads Ep.9: Becoming Jia Zhangke: Part One
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Director Jia Zhangke joins CrossRoads with Luo Yonghao for an intimate conversation on cinema, memory, and becoming himself. From Platform to Still Life, his lens captures ordinary people and fading times â€” revealing the quiet pulse of Chinaâ€™s transformation.
While most cameras chase neon skylines and tales of heroes, Jia Zhangkeâ€™s lens has always stayed grounded â€” focused on the soil beneath his feet. In his films, there are few grand battles or dramatic rescues â€” only the quiet pulse of life in Shanxiâ€™s small towns: coal mines, motorcycles, county dance troupes, drifting youth, and the fragile silhouettes of people caught between eras. Those forgotten by history find their voices in Jiaâ€™s frame â€” ordinary, steady, yet resonant â€” echoing from the skies over Fenyang to the nights of Venice. In this ninth episode of Crossroads with Luo Yonghao, we sit down with director Jia Zhangke, a filmmaker whose works (Platform, Still Life, A Touch of Sin, Mountains May Depart, Ash Is Purest White) continue to map the emotional geography of modern China. To converse with Jia is to step into his cinema: honest, grounded, calm, and deeply human. His words, like his images, reveal the unseen currents beneath ordinary life â€” where longing meets history, the mundane finds a voice, and silence tells its own truth. Together, we trace the journey of a once-restless youth wandering the streets of Fenyang â€” who found his way, step by step, to the Golden Lion stage of the Venice Film Festival. ã€Šç½—æ°¸æµ©çš„åå­—è·¯å£ã€‹æ’­å®¢èŠ‚ç›®ç®€ä»‹ æœ¬èŠ‚â½¬æ˜¯â¼€æ¡£ç”±ç½—æ°¸æµ©ä¸»æŒçš„æ·±åº¦æ’­å®¢ç±»èŠ‚â½¬ï¼Œæ¯é›†é•¿è¾¾ä¸‰åˆ°äº”ä¸ªå°æ—¶ã€‚ æˆ‘ä»¬ä¸æ—¶ä»£æµªæ½®ä¸­çš„â¼ˆç‰©å±•å¼€å¯¹è¯ï¼Œèšç„¦äºç§‘æŠ€ä¸â¼ˆâ½‚é¢†åŸŸï¼Œè®²è¿°ä¸ªä½“å‘½è¿æ•…äº‹ï¼Œæ¢è®¨æ—¶ä»£å‘å±•è¶‹åŠ¿ã€‚
